A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Rian Johnson's inability to put himself in the mind of the reoccurring characters\, and to understand the physics and nature of the force\, have resulted in a film that lacks any cohesion to many precedents. It is as if he has disregarded the majority of the previous 6 films\, and done has he pleased. Which is the equivalent of a writer with Alzheimer's. Storytelling is the most important aspect of Star Wars\, and for someone to so fragrantly cast aside so many precedents\, has thus made a joke of the series; very unfortunate.
